newsitem.title: USA: C-TEC gets IRS OK for tax-free spin-offs.
newsitem.headline: C-TEC gets IRS OK for tax-free spin-offs.

text.p: C-TEC Corp said Wednesday it has won Internal Revenue Service approval for the tax-free spin-off of two existing segments to form three separate, publicly traded companies.
The company also said it suspending discussions on the acquisition of Mercom Inc until after completion of the spin-offs and restructuring.
Under the proposal, each shareholder of C-TEC Corp will receive shares in each of the two new companies, it said. It is anticipated all three companies will trade on Nasdaq.
C-TEC said the new companies will be:

-- RCN Corp (proposed ticker symbol RCNC), which will consist of RCN Telecom Services; C-TEC's current cable television operations in the Boston-Washington, D.C., corridor; and the company's investment in Mexico's Megacable SA do CV.
-- Commonwealth Telephone Enterprises Inc (proposed ticker symbol CTCO), which will consist of the company's local telephone operations in Pennsylvania and related businesses in Pennsylvania.
-- Cable Michigan Inc (proposed ticker symbol CABL), which will consist of the company's traditional cable television operations in Michigan, including its 62 percent ownership of Mercom.

C-TEC had proposed to acquire full ownership of Mercom through a stock swap currently under consideration by a special committee of the Mercom board, it said. Those talks are suspended until the spin-offs are completed.

The company said the previously announced restructuring will enhance future capital-raising efforts, provide more focused, equity-based employee incentives and make it easier for the investment community to track the performance of the three distinct and independent businesses.
McCourt said the restructuring should be completed by the end of the year.
